alert.note: Alert for Eastern Walsh County; Grand Forks; Pembina; Steele; Traill (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued March 11 at 9:57PM CDT until March 12 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM CDT SUNDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM TO 1 PM CDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches, with a light glaze of ice possible due to mixed precipitation. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow and drifting snow expected. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Minnesota and northeast and southeast North Dakota. * WHEN...For the Blizzard Warning, until 7 AM CDT Sunday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 7 AM to 1 PM CDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for North Dakota can be found at travel.dot.nd.gov and for Minnesota at 511mn.org, or by calling 5 1 1 in either state.
